original: Pañcaviṃśatisāhasrikā prajñāpāramitā🔽namo bhagavadyai āryaprajñāpāramitāyai//
analyzed: pañcaviṃśati sāhasrikā prajñāpāramitā  namaḥ bhagavadyai ārya prajñāpāramitāyai
translated: The Perfection of Wisdom in Twenty-five Thousand Lines🔽Homage to the Blessed Noble Perfection of Wisdom!

original: nirvikalpe namas tubhyaṃ prajñāpāramite 'mite/
analyzed: nirvikalpe namaḥ tubhyam prajñāpāramite mite
translated: Homage to you, O non-conceptual one, O Perfection of Wisdom, O infinite one!

original: yā tvaṃ sarvān avadyāṅgi niravadyair nirīkṣyase//
analyzed: yā tvam sarvān avadya aṅgi niravadyaiḥ nirīkṣyase
translated: You who are seen by all those with faultless limbs as faultless!

original: ākāśam iva nirlepāṃ niṣprapañcāṃ nirakṣarām//
analyzed: ākāśam iva nirlepām niṣprapañcām nirakṣarām
translated: Like space, you are unstained, free from conceptual proliferation, and without letters.

original: yas tvāṃ paśyati bhāvena sa paśyati tathāgatam//
analyzed: yaḥ tvām paśyati bhāvena sa paśyati tathāgatam
translated: One who sees you with devotion sees the Thus-Gone One.

original: tava cāryaguṇādyāyā buddhasya ca jagadguroḥ/
analyzed: tava ca ārya guṇa ādyāyāḥ buddhasya ca jagadguroḥ
translated: The noble ones, who have set out for your qualities, O mother of the Buddha, the teacher of the world,

original: na paśyanty antaraṃ santaś candracandrikayor iva//🔽kṛpātmakāḥ prapadya tvāṃ buddhadharmapuraḥsarām/
analyzed: na paśyanti antaram santaḥ candra candrikayoḥ iva  kṛpā ātmakāḥ prapadya tvām buddha dharma puraḥsarām
translated: Do not see any difference between you and the Buddha, just as the moon and moonlight.🔽Those who are compassionate, who have set out for you, O mother of the Buddha and the Dharma,

original: sukhenāyānti māhātmām atulaṃ bhaktivatsale//🔽sakṛd apy āśaye śuddhe yas tvāṃ vidhivad īkṣate/
analyzed: sukhena āyānti atulam bhakti vatsale  sakṛt api āśaye śuddhe yaḥ tvām vidhivat īkṣate
translated: Easily attain the incomparable greatness, O you who are devoted to your devotees.🔽Even one who sees you properly just once with a pure intention

original: tenāpi niyataṃ siddhiḥ prāpyate 'moghadarśane//
analyzed: tena api niyatam siddhiḥ prāpyate mogha darśane
translated: Will certainly attain accomplishment, O you who are not seen without effect.

original: sarveṣām api vīrāṇāṃ parārthe niyatātmanām/
analyzed: sarveṣām api vīrāṇām parārthe niyata ātmanām
translated: Of all the heroes who are dedicated to the welfare of others,

original: poṣikā janayitrī ca mātā tvam asi vatsalā//
analyzed: poṣikā janayitrī ca mātā tvam asi vatsalā
translated: You are the nourishing, giving birth mother, O loving one.

original: yad buddhā lokaguravaḥ putrās tava kṛpālavaḥ/
analyzed: yat buddhāḥ loka guravaḥ putrāḥ tava kṛpālavaḥ
translated: The Buddhas, the teachers of the world, are your compassionate sons,

original: tena tvam asi kalyāṇi sarvasattvapitāmahī//
analyzed: tena tvam asi kalyāṇi sarva sattva pitāmahī
translated: Therefore, O auspicious one, you are the grandmother of all beings.

original: sarvapāramitābhis tvaṃ nirmalābhir anindite/
analyzed: sarva pāramitābhiḥ tvam nirmalābhiḥ anindite
translated: O irreproachable one, you are always followed by all the immaculate perfections,

original: candralekheva tārābhir anuyātāsi sarvadā//🔽vineyaṃ janamāsādya tatra tatra tathāgathaiḥ/
analyzed: candra lekhā iva tārābhiḥ anuyātā asi sarvadā  vineyam janam āsādya tatra tatra tathāgathaiḥ
translated: like the lunar digit by the stars.

original: bahurūpā tvam evaikā nānānāmabhir īḍyase//
analyzed: bahu rūpā tvam eva ekā nānā nāmabhiḥ īḍyase
translated: Having reached the people to be trained, you alone in various forms are praised by various names by the Tathāgatas in various places.

original: prabhāṃ prāpyeva dīptāṃśor avaśyāyodabindavaḥ/🔽tvāṃ prāpya pralayaṃ yānti doṣā vādāś ca vādinām//
analyzed: prabhām prāpya iva dīpta aṃśoḥ avaśyāya uda bindavaḥ  tvām prāpya pralayam yānti doṣāḥ vādāḥ ca vādinām
translated: Just as the drops of dew on grass perish upon reaching the bright light of the sun,🔽so do the faults and arguments of the disputants perish upon reaching you.

original: tvam eva trāsajananī bālānāṃ bhīmadarśanā/
analyzed: tvam eva trāsa jananī bālānām bhīma darśanā
translated: You alone are the one who generates fear in the timid ones with your terrifying appearance,

original: āśvāsajananī cāsi viduṣāṃ saumyadarśanā//
analyzed: āśvāsa jananī ca asi viduṣām saumya darśanā
translated: and you are the one who generates confidence in the wise ones with your gentle appearance.

original: yasya tvayy apy abhiṣvaṅgas tvannāthasya na vidyate/
analyzed: yasya tvayi api abhiṣvaṅgaḥ tvad nāthasya na vidyate
translated: For one who has no attachment even towards you, O mother, the consort of Shiva,

original: tasyāṃba katham anyatra rāgadveṣau bhaviṣyataḥ//
analyzed: tasya aṃba katham anyatra rāga dveṣau bhaviṣyataḥ
translated: how can there be passion and hatred towards anything else?

original: nāgacchasi kutaś cittaṃ na ca kvacana gacchasi/
analyzed: na āgacchasi kutas cittam na ca kvacana gacchasi
translated: The mind does not come from anywhere, nor does it go anywhere.

original: sthāneṣv api ca sarveṣu vidvadbhir nopalabhyase//
analyzed: sthāneṣu api ca sarveṣu vidvadbhiḥ nā upalabhyase
translated: It is not perceived by the wise in any of the places.

original: ye tvām evaṃ na paśyanti prapadyante ca bhāvataḥ/
analyzed: ye tvām evam na paśyanti prapadyante ca bhāvataḥ
translated: Those who do not see you in this way, and who resort to you in reality,

original: prapadya ca vimucyante tad idaṃ mahad adbhutam//
analyzed: prapadya ca vimucyante tat idam mahat adbhutam
translated: And by resorting to you, they are liberated - this is a great wonder.

original: tvām eva badhyate paśyann apaśyann api badhyate/
analyzed: tvām eva badhyate paśyan a paśyan api badhyate
translated: Seeing you, one is bound; not seeing you, one is also bound.

original: tvām eva mucyate paśyann apaśyann api mucyate//
analyzed: tvām eva mucyate paśyan a paśyan api mucyate
translated: Seeing you, one is liberated; not seeing you, one is also liberated.

original: aho vismayanīyāsi gambhīrāsi yaśasvinī/
analyzed: aho vismayanīyā asi gambhīrā asi yaśasvinī
translated: Ah! You are to be marveled at, you are profound, you are glorious.

original: sudurbodhāsi māyeva dṛśyase na ca dṛśyase//
analyzed: su durbodhā asi māyā iva dṛśyase na ca dṛśyase
translated: You are difficult to understand, like an illusion; you are seen but not seen.

original: buddhaiḥ prayekabuddhaiś ca śrāvakaiś ca niṣevitā/
analyzed: buddhaiḥ prayekabuddhaiḥ ca śrāvakaiḥ ca niṣevitā
translated: You are frequented by Buddhas, Pratyekabuddhas, and Shravakas.

original: mārgas tvam eko mokṣasya nāsty anya iti niścayaḥ//
analyzed: mārgaḥ tvam ekaḥ mokṣasya na asti anyaḥ iti niścayaḥ
translated: You are the one path to liberation; there is no other - this is certain.

original: vyavahāraṃ puraskṛtya prajñaptyarthaṃ śarīriṇām/
analyzed: vyavahāram puraskṛtya prajñapti artham śarīriṇām
translated: Placing conventionality at the forefront, for the sake of teaching embodied beings,

original: kṛpayā lokanāthais tvam ucyase ca na cocyase//🔽śaktaḥ kas tvām iha stotuṃ nirnimittāṃ nirañjanām/
analyzed: kṛpayā lokanāthaiḥ tvam ucyase ca na ca ucyase  śaktaḥ kaḥ tvām iha stotum nirnimittām nirañjanām
translated: Out of compassion, the Lords of the World speak of you, and yet you are not spoken of.🔽Who is able to praise you here, who are without attributes, unsullied,

original: sarvavāgvisayātītā yā tvaṃ kvacid aniḥśritā//
analyzed: sarva vāc visaya atītā yā tvam kvacid a niḥśritā
translated: Beyond the scope of all speech, in some places not even based?

original: saty evam api saṃvṛtyā vākpathair vayam īdṛśaiḥ/
analyzed: satī evam api saṃvṛtyā vākpathaiḥ vayam īdṛśaiḥ
translated: Even though this is so, we, out of convention, with such words as these,

original: tvām astutyām api stutvā tuṣṭūṣantaḥ sunirvṛtāaḥ/
analyzed: tvām a stutyām api stutvā tuṣṭūṣantaḥ su nirvṛtāḥ
translated: Having praised you, who are beyond praise, being satisfied, we are well-pleased.

original: prajñāpāramitāṃ stutvā yan mayopacitaṃ śubham/
analyzed: prajñāpāramitām stutvā yat mayā upacitam śubham
translated: The merit that I have accumulated by praising the Perfection of Wisdom,

original: tenās tv āśu jagat kṛtsnaṃ prajñāpāraparāyaṇam//
analyzed: tena as tu āśu jagat kṛtsnam prajñā pāra parāyaṇam
translated: Therefore, the entire world is quickly devoted to the perfection of wisdom.

original: evaṃ mayā śrutam/
analyzed: evam mayā śrutam
translated: Thus have I heard.

original: ekasmin samaye bhagavān rājagṛhe viharati sma
analyzed: ekasmin samaye bhagavān rājagṛhe viharati sma
translated: At one time the Blessed One was dwelling in Rājagṛha

original: gṛdhrakūṭe parvate mahatā bhikṣusaṃghena sārdhaṃ pañcamātrair bhikṣusahasraiḥ sarvair arhadbhiḥ
analyzed: gṛdhrakūṭe parvate mahatā bhikṣu saṃghena sārdham pañca mātraiḥ bhikṣu sahasraiḥ sarvaiḥ arhadbhiḥ
translated: on the Vulture Peak mountain together with a great assembly of monks, with five thousand monks, all of them arhats,

original: kṣīṇāsravair niṣkleśair vaśībhūtaiḥ suvimuktacittaiḥ suvimuktaprajñair ājāneyai
analyzed: kṣīṇa āsravaiḥ niṣkleśaiḥ vaśībhūtaiḥ su vimukta cittaiḥ su vimukta prajñaiḥ
translated: with exhausted defilements, without afflictions, with controlled senses, with well-liberated minds, with well-liberated wisdom, with thoroughbred minds,

original: r mahānāgaiḥ kṛtakṛtyaiḥ kṛtakaraṇīyair apahṛtabhārair anuprāprasvakārthaiḥ parikṣīṇa
analyzed: R mahā nāgaiḥ kṛtakṛtyaiḥ kṛta karaṇīyaiḥ apahṛta bhāraiḥ anuprāpra svaka arthaiḥ parikṣīṇaiḥ
translated: with great elephants, with their work done, their task accomplished, their burden laid down, their own goal attained, with fetters that bound them to existence extinguished,

original: bhavasaṃyojanaiḥ samyagājñāsuvimuktacittaiḥ sarvacetovaśiparamapāramitāprāptaiḥ /
analyzed: bhava saṃyojanaiḥ samyak ājñā su vimukta cittaiḥ sarva cetaḥ vaśi parama pāramitā prāptaiḥ
translated: with their minds well-liberated by right knowledge, having attained the utmost perfection of control over all mental states.

original: pañcamātrair bhikṣuṇīśatair upāsakair upāsikābhiś ca sārdhaṃ sarvair dṛṣṭadharmair apari
analyzed: pañca mātraiḥ bhikṣuṇī śataiḥ upāsakaiḥ upāsikābhiḥ ca sārdham sarvaiḥ dṛṣṭa dharmaiḥ apari
translated: Together with five hundred nuns, laymen, and laywomen, all of whom had seen the Dharma,

original: māṇairś ca bodhisattvakoṭīniyutaśatasahasraiḥ sārdhaṃ sarvair dhāraṇīpratilabdhaiḥ
analyzed: ca bodhisattva koṭī niyuta śata sahasraiḥ sārdham sarvaiḥ dhāraṇī pratilabdhaiḥ
translated: and with innumerable hundreds of thousands of niyutas of koṭīs of bodhisattvas, all of whom had attained retention,

original: śūnyatāvihāribhir animittagocaraiḥ praṇidhānākalpitaiḥ kṣāntisamatāprati
analyzed: śūnyatā vihāribhiḥ animitta gocaraiḥ praṇidhāna a kalpitaiḥ kṣānti samatā prati
translated: who dwelt in emptiness, whose sphere was the signless, who were not attached to vows, who had attained the equanimity of acceptance,

original: labdhair asaṅgadhāraṇīpratilabdhair acyutābhijñair ādeyavacanair akuhakair alapakair arapagata🔽jñātralābhacittair nirāmiṣadharmadeśakair gaṃbhīradharmakṣāntipāraṃgatair vaiśāradya
analyzed: labdhaiḥ asaṅga dhāraṇī pratilabdhaiḥ acyuta abhijñaiḥ ādeya vacanaiḥ akuhakaiḥ a lapakaiḥ  jñātra lābha cittaiḥ nirāmiṣa dharma deśakaiḥ gaṃbhīra dharma kṣānti pāraṃgataiḥ vaiśāradya
translated: who had attained unattached retention, who had unshakable higher knowledge, whose words were accepted, who were not deceitful, who did not prattle, who were free from deceit,🔽whose minds were not attached to gain or honor, who taught the Dharma without concern for material things, who had perfected the acceptance of the profound Dharma, who had attained fearlessness,

original: prāptair mārakarmasamatikrāntaiḥ karmāvaraṇapratiprasrabdhair dharmapravicayavibhakti🔽nirdeśakuśalair asaṃkhyeyakalpapraṇidhānasusamārabdhaiḥ smitamukhaiḥ pūrvālāpibhi
analyzed: prāptaiḥ māra karma samatikrāntaiḥ karma āvaraṇa pratiprasrabdhaiḥ dharma pravicaya vibhakti  nirdeśa kuśalaiḥ asaṃkhyeya kalpa praṇidhāna su samārabdhaiḥ smita mukhaiḥ pūrva ālāpibhiḥ
translated: who had transcended the deeds of Māra, who had eliminated the obscurations of karma, who were skilled in teaching the analysis of phenomena,🔽who were well-established in the vows of innumerable eons, who had smiling faces, who were the first to speak,

original: r vigatabhṛkuṭīmukhair gāthābhir gītālapanakuśalair apagatalīnacittair anācchedyaprati
analyzed: R vigata bhṛkuṭī mukhaiḥ gāthābhiḥ gīta ālapana kuśalaiḥ apagata līna cittaiḥ anācchedya prati
translated: who were free from frowns, who were skilled in singing and speaking in verse, whose minds were free from depression, whose eloquence was uninterrupted,

original: bhānair anantaparṣadabhibhavanavaiśāradyasamanvāgair anantakalpakoṭīniḥsaraṇakuśalai
analyzed: ananta parṣad abhibhavana vaiśāradya samanvāgaiḥ ananta kalpa koṭī niḥsaraṇa kuśalaiḥ
translated: who were endowed with the fearlessness of overwhelming infinite assemblies, who were skilled in escaping from innumerable millions of eons,

original: r māyāmarīcidakacandrasvapnapratiśrutkāpratibhāsapratibimbanirmāṇopamadharmā
analyzed: R māyā marīci daka candra svapna pratiśrutkā pratibhāsa pratibimba nirmāṇa upama dharmā
translated: who were skilled in the Dharma that is like an illusion, a mirage, the reflection of the moon in water, a dream, an echo, a mirage, a magical creation,

original: dhimuktaiḥ sattvagaticaritasūkṣmanānādhimuktyavatārakuśalair apratihatacittai
analyzed: adhimuktaiḥ sattva gati carita sūkṣma nānā adhimukti avatāra kuśalaiḥ a pratihata cittaiḥ
translated: They were skilled in guiding beings according to their inclinations, subtle and various, without obstruction in their minds,

original: r adhimātraksāntisamanvāgatair yāthātmāvatāraṇakuśalaiḥ sarvabuddhakṣetraānantavyūha🔽praṇidhānaprasthānaparigṛhītair asaṃkhyeyalokadhātubuddhānusmṛtisamāhita
analyzed: R adhimātra sānti samanvāgataiḥ yāthātmya avatāraṇa kuśalaiḥ sarva buddhakṣetra ānanta vyūhaiḥ  praṇidhāna prasthāna parigṛhītaiḥ asaṃkhyeya lokadhātu buddha anusmṛti samāhita
translated: endowed with supreme patience, skilled in guiding according to the truth, having made the vow and set out to adorn all buddha-fields🔽with infinite arrays, always and constantly facing the buddhas of innumerable world systems, absorbed in recollection,

original: satatasamitābhimukhībhūtair aparimitabuddhādhyeṣaṇakuśalair nānādṛṣṭyanuśayaparyava
analyzed: satata samitā abhimukhībhūtaiḥ aparimita buddha adhyeṣaṇa kuśalaiḥ nānā dṛṣṭi anuśaya paryavasthā
translated: skilled in requesting immeasurable buddhas, skilled in pacifying the afflictions that arise from various views, latent tendencies, and attachments,

original: sthānakleśapraśamanakuśalaiḥ samādhivikrīḍitaśatasahasranirhārakuśalaiḥ tad yathā
analyzed: sthāna kleśa praśamana kuśalaiḥ samādhi vikrīḍita śata sahasra nirhāra kuśalaiḥ tat yathā
translated: skilled in accomplishing hundreds of thousands of meditative absorptions, namely:

original: bhadrapālena ca bodhisattvena mahāsattvena ratnākareṇa ca sārthavāhena ca nara
analyzed: bhadrapālena ca bodhisattvena mahāsattvena ratnākareṇa ca sārthavāhena ca nara
translated: the bodhisattva mahāsattva Bhadrapāla, Ratnākara, Sārthavāha,

original: dattena ca varuṇadattena ca śubhaguptena ca indradattena ca uttaramatinā ca viśeṣa
analyzed: dattena ca varuṇadattena ca śubhaguptena ca indradattena ca uttaramatinā ca
translated: Naradatta, Varuṇadatta, Śubhagupta, Indradatta, Uttamati, Viśeṣa

original: matinā ca vardhamānamatinā ca amoghadarśinā ca susamprasthitena ca suvi
analyzed: matinā ca vardhamānamatinā ca amoghadarśinā ca susamprasthitena ca suvi
translated: mati, Vardhamānamati, Amoghadarśin, Susamprasthita, Suvi

original: krāntavikramiṇā ca nityodyuktena ca anikṣiptadhureṇa ca sūryagarbheṇa ca🔽anupamacintinā ca avalokiteśvareṇa ca mahāsthāmaprāptena ca mañju🔽śriyā ca vajramatinā ca ratnamudrāhastena ca nityokṣiptahastena ca maitre🔽yeṇa ca bodhisattvena mahāsattvena evam pramukhair anekair bodhisattvakoṭīniyuta
analyzed: krānta vikramiṇā ca nitya udyuktena ca a nikṣipta dhureṇa ca sūrya garbheṇa ca  anupamacintinā ca avalokiteśvareṇa ca mahāsthāmaprāptena ca mañju  śriyā ca vajramatinā ca ratna mudrā hastena ca nitya ukṣipta hastena ca maitre  yeṇa ca bodhisattvena mahāsattvena evam pramukhaiḥ anekaiḥ bodhisattva koṭī niyuta
translated: Kṣitigarbha, Nityodyukta, Akṣayamati, Akṣayamati, Sūryagarbha,🔽Anupamacinta, Avalokiteśvara, Mahāsthāmaprāpta, Mañjuśrī,🔽Vajramati, Ratnamu-drahasta, Nityotkaṭahasta, Maitreya,🔽and other bodhisattva mahāsattvas, many with hundreds of thousands of bodhisattvas as their retinue.

original: śatasahasraiḥ sārdham/
analyzed: śata sahasraiḥ sārdham
translated: Kṣitigarbha, Avalokiteśvara, Mahāsthāmaprāpta, Mañjuśrī, Vajramati, Ratna­mudrā­hasta, Nityotkaṭa­hasta, Maitreya, and other such bodhisattva mahāsattvas, many hundreds of thousands of niyutas of koṭis of bodhisattvas.

original: atha khalu bhagavān svayam eva siṃhāsanaṃ prajñapya nyaṣīdat paryaṅkaṃ baddhvā
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavān svayam eva siṃhāsanam prajñapya nyaṣīdat paryaṅkam baddhvā
translated: Then the Blessed One himself arranged a lion throne and sat down, binding his legs in full lotus posture,

original: ṛjukāyaṃ praṇidhāya abhimukhīṃ smṛtim upasthāpya samādhirājaṃ nāma
analyzed: ṛju kāyam praṇidhāya abhimukhīm smṛtim upasthāpya samādhirājam nāma
translated: straightening his body, and establishing his mindfulness in front of him. He entered the samādhi called King of Samādhis,

original: samādhiṃ samāpadyate sma yatra sarvasamādhayo 'ntargamān saṃgrahaṃ samava🔽saraṇaṃ gacchanti/
analyzed: samādhim samāpadyate sma yatra sarva samādhayaḥ ntargamān saṃgraham samava  saraṇam gacchanti
translated: in which all samādhis are included, gathered, and converge.

original: atha khalu bhagavān smṛtimān samprajānaṃs tasmāt samādher vyutthāya
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavān smṛtimān samprajānan tasmāt samādheḥ vyutthāya
translated: Then the Blessed One, mindful and aware, arose from that samādhi

original: divyena cakṣuṣā sarvalokadhātuṃ vyavalokya sarvakāyāt smitam akarot/
analyzed: divyena cakṣuṣā sarva lokadhātum vyavalokya sarva kāyāt smitam akarot
translated: and, looking with his divine eye at all the world systems, smiled with all his body.

original: tasyādhastāt pādatalayoḥ sahasrārābhyāṃ cakrābhyāṃ ṣaṣṭiṣaṣṭīraśmikoṭī🔽niyutaśatasahasrāṇi niśceruḥ daśabhyaḥ pādāṅgulibhyaḥ ṣaṣṭiṣaṣṭīraśmikoṭī
analyzed: tasya adhastāt pāda talayoḥ sahasra arābhyām cakrābhyām ṣaṣṭi ṣaṣṭī raśmi koṭī  niyuta śata sahasrāṇi niśceruḥ daśabhyaḥ pāda aṅgulibhyaḥ ṣaṣṭi ṣaṣṭī raśmi koṭī
translated: Below him, from the thousand-spoked wheels on the soles of his feet, sixty-six hundred thousand koṭis of niyutas of rays

original: niyutaśatasahasrāṇi niśceruḥ/
analyzed: niyuta śata sahasrāṇi niśceruḥ
translated: issued forth. From the ten toes, sixty-six hundred thousand koṭis of niyutas of rays🔽issued forth.

original: atha khalu bhagavān

analyzed: taiḥ ca padmaiḥ te lokadhātavaḥ sphuṭāḥ abhūvan

analyzed: atha khalu te bodhisattvāḥ te ca gṛhasthāḥ te ca pravrajitāḥ te ca dārakāḥ tāḥ ca  dārikāḥ tatas ratnāvatyāḥ lokadhātoḥ samantaraśminā bodhisattvena mahāsattvena sārdham
translated: Then those bodhisattvas, those householders, those renunciants, those boys,🔽and those girls, together with the bodhisattva mahāsattva Samantaprabhāsa,

original: nyaṣīdan/

translated: sat down to one side.

translated: Then in the northern direction, beyond as many world systems as there are sands in the Ganges River, from the world system called Jaya,🔽the Tathāgata, Arhat, Perfectly Awakened One named Jayendra,

analyzed: evam ukte ratnākaraḥ tathāgataḥ samantaraśmim bodhisattvam etat avocat

analyzed: kaḥ bhagavan hetuḥ kaḥ pratyayaḥ sya mahataḥ vabhāsasya loke prādurbhāvāya asya ca mahataḥ pṛthivīcālasya asya ca tathāgatasya asecanaka ātma bhāvasya
translated: What, Blessed One, is the cause, what is the reason for the appearance of this great light in the world, for this great earthquake, and for this inspiring physical form of the Tathāgata?

original: evam ukte ratnākaras tathāgataḥ samantaraśmiṃ bodhisattvam etad avocat/
analyzed: evam ukte ratnākaraḥ tathāgataḥ samantaraśmim bodhisattvam etat avocat
translated: When this was said, the Tathāgata Ratnakarā said this to the Bodhisattva Samantaprabha:

original: asti kulaputra ito dakṣiṇapaścimāyāṃ diśi gaṅgānadīvālukopamān lokadhātūn
analyzed: asti kula putraḥ itas dakṣiṇa paścimāyām diśi gaṅgā nadī vālukā upamān lokadhātūn
translated: Son of good family, to the southwest of here, beyond world systems equal to the sands of the Ganges River,

original: atikramya sahā nāma lokadhātuḥ tatra śākyamunir nāma tathāgato 'rhan samyaksambuddhas
analyzed: atikramya sahāḥ nāma lokadhātuḥ tatra śākyamuniḥ nāma tathāgataḥ rhan samyaksambuddhaḥ
translated: there is a world system called Saha. There, a Tathāgata, an Arhat, a Perfectly Enlightened One named Śākyamuni

original: tiṣṭhati dhriyate yāpayati /
analyzed: tiṣṭhati dhriyate yāpayati
translated: resides, is present, and lives.

original: sa bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānāṃ prajñāpāramitāṃ samprakāśayati tasyāyām īdṛśo 'nubhāvaḥ/
analyzed: sa bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām prajñāpāramitām samprakāśayati tasyāḥ āyām īdṛśaḥ nubhāvaḥ
translated: That is the power of the one who teaches the perfection of wisdom to the bodhisattva-mahāsattvas.

original: atha khalu samantaraśmir bodhisattvo ratnākaraṃ tathāgatm etad avocat/
analyzed: atha khalu samantaraśmiḥ bodhisattvaḥ ratnākaram tathāgatm etat avocat
translated: Then the bodhisattva Samantaprabhāsa said this to the Tathāgata Ratnākara:

original: gamisyāmy ahaṃ bhagavaṃs tāṃ sahāṃ lokadhātuṃ tañ ca śākyamuniṃ tathāgataṃ darśanāya
analyzed: gamisyāmi aham bhagavan tām sahām lokadhātum tam ca śākyamunim tathāgatam darśanāya
translated: Blessed One, I will go to that Sahā world system to see that Tathāgata Śākyamuni,

original: vandanāya paryupāsanāya tāṃś ca bodhisattvān mahāsattvān bhūyas tvena kumārabhūtān
analyzed: vandanāya paryupāsanāya tān ca bodhisattvān mahāsattvān bhūyas tvena kumāra bhūtān

original: dhāraṇīpratilabdhān samādhinirhārakuśalān sarvasamādhivaśipāramitāṃ gatān /
analyzed: dhāraṇī pratilabdhān samādhi nirhāra kuśalān sarva samādhi vaśi pāramitām gatān
translated: who has attained retention, is skilled in the attainment of samādhis, and has gone to the perfection of all samādhis.

original: bhagavān āha gaccha tvaṃ kulaputra yasyedānīṃ kālaṃ manyase/
analyzed: bhagavān āha gaccha tvam kula putra yasya idānīm kālam manyase
translated: The Blessed One said, Go, son of noble family, if you think it is the right time.

original: atha khalu ratnākaras tathāgato nānāratnamayāni suvarṇāvabhāsāni sahasrapatrāṇi padmāni samantaraśmaye bodhisattvāya prādāt/

translated: Then the Tathāgata Ratnākara gave the bodhisattva Samantaprabhāsa thousands of lotuses made of various jewels, shining with gold.

analyzed: etaiḥ tvam kula putra padmaiḥ tam śākyamunim tathāgatam abhyavakireḥ

analyzed: imāni ca tena bhagavatā ratnākareṇa tathāgatena arhatā samyaksaṃbuddhena padmāni prahitāni bhagavataḥ iti
translated: And these lotuses were sent by the Blessed One, the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened Buddha Ratnākara to the Blessed One.'

analyzed: samprajāna kārī ca tvam kula putra buddhakṣetre bhūyāḥ
translated: And, son of good family, be mindful in the Buddha-field.

original: tat kasya hetor durāsadā hi te bodhisattvā ye tatra sahāyāṃ lokadhātau upapannāḥ/🔽atha khalu samantaraśmir bodhisattvo ratnākarasya tathāgatasya sakāśāt tāni nānāratnamayāni
analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ durāsadāḥ hi te bodhisattvāḥ ye tatra sahāyām lokadhātau upapannāḥ  atha khalu samantaraśmiḥ bodhisattvaḥ ratnākarasya tathāgatasya sakāśāt tāni nānā ratna mayāni
translated: Why is that? Because those bodhisattvas who have been reborn in that Sahā world-system are difficult to approach.🔽Then the bodhisattva Samantaprabhāsa, having taken those lotuses made of various jewels

analyzed: padmāni gṛhītvā suvarṇa nirbhāsā niḥsahasra patrāṇi anekaiḥ bodhisattva koṭi niyuta śata sahasraiḥ

analyzed: gṛhasthaiḥ pravrajitaiḥ ca dārakaiḥ dārikābhiḥ ca sārdham parivṛtaḥ puraskṛtaḥ pūrvasyām
translated: both householders and renunciants, boys and girls, surrounded and venerated, went to the east,

analyzed: diśi teṣu gaṅgā nadī vālukā upameṣu lokadhātuṣu buddhānām bhagavataḥ satkurvan gurūkurvan

original: mānayan pūjayan puṣpadhūpagandhamālyavilepanacūrṇacīvaracchattradhvajapatākāvaijayantībhir
analyzed: mānayan pūjayan puṣpa dhūpa gandha mālya vilepana cūrṇa cīvara chattra dhvaja patākā vaijayantībhiḥ

analyzed: yena iyam sahā lokadhātuḥ tena saṃprāptaḥ
translated: he arrived in this Sahā world system.

analyzed: yena ca śākyamuniḥ tathāgataḥ tena upasaṃkrāntaḥ

analyzed: ekānte sthitaḥ ca samantaraśmiḥ bodhisattvaḥ bhagavantam śākyamunim etat avocat

original: imāni ca tena bhagavatā ratnākareṇa tathāgatena nānāratnamayāni suvarṇanirbhāsāni sahasrapatrāṇi padmāni preṣitāni
analyzed: imāni ca tena bhagavatā ratnākareṇa tathāgatena nānā ratna mayāni suvarṇa nirbhāsāni sahasra patrāṇi padmāni preṣitāni
translated: And those thousand-petaled lotuses made of various jewels and shining with gold were sent by that Blessed One, the Tathâgata Ratna-ākara,

original: bhagavataḥ/
analyzed: bhagavataḥ
translated: to the Blessed One.

original: atha khalu bhagavān śākyamuniḥ tathāgatas tāni padmāni gṛhītvā yena te uttarapūrvasyāṃ diśi gaṅgānadīvālukopamā lokadhātavas tena

translated: And on those lotuses were seated the figures of Buddhas, and in those Buddha-fields they were teaching the Dharma, namely this very teaching of the Dharma connected with the perfection of wisdom.

analyzed: atha tatra lokadhātau padmahastaḥ nāma tatra bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ tam  mahāntam avabhāsam dṛṣṭvā tam ca mahāntam pṛthivīcālam tam ca bhagavataḥ āsecanakam  ātma bhāvam dṛṣṭvā yena bhagavān ratnākaraḥ tathāgataḥ rhan samykasaṃbuddhaḥ tena upasaṃkrāmat

analyzed: upasaṃkramya tasya bhagavataḥ pādau abhivandya tam tathāgatam ratnākaram etat avocat
translated: Having approached, he bowed his head at the Blessed One's feet and said this to the Blessed One Ratna-kara:

analyzed: kaḥ bhagavan hetuḥ kaḥ pratyayaḥ sya mahataḥ vabhāsasya loke prādurbhāvāya asya ca mahataḥ pṛthivīcālasya asya ca tathāgatasya asecanaka ātma bhāvasya

original: yaiś ca sattvaiḥ sa dharmaḥ śrutas te niyatā abhūvan anuttarāyāṃ samyaksambodhau/
analyzed: yaiḥ ca sattvaiḥ sa dharmaḥ śrutaḥ te niyatāḥ abhūvan anuttarāyām samyaksambodhau
translated: And those beings who heard that Dharma became destined for unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: atha khalu te bodhisattvās te ca gṛhasthās te ca pravrajitās te ca dārakās tāś ca
analyzed: atha khalu te bodhisattvāḥ te ca gṛhasthāḥ te ca pravrajitāḥ te ca dārakāḥ tāḥ ca
translated: Then those bodhisattvas, those householders, those renunciants, those boys,

original: dārikās tato ratnāvatyā lokadhātoḥ samantaraśminā bodhisattvena mahāsattvena sārdham
analyzed: dārikāḥ tatas ratnāvatyāḥ lokadhātoḥ samantaraśminā bodhisattvena mahāsattvena sārdham
translated: and those girls, having come from the world system called Ratnāvatī together with the bodhisattva mahāsattva Samantaprabhāsa,

original: āgatāḥ svakasvakaiḥ kuśalamūlair bhagavantaṃ śākyamuniṃ satkṛtya gurūkṛtya sammānya
analyzed: āgatāḥ svaka svakaiḥ kuśala mūlaiḥ bhagavantam śākyamunim satkṛtya gurūkṛtya sammānya
translated: having honored, revered, and worshipped the Blessed One Śākyamuni with their own roots of merit,

original: saṃpūjyaikānte nyaṣīdan /🔽atha khalu paścimottarasyāṃ diśi gaṅgānadīvālukopamān lokadhātūn atikramya tebhyo yaḥ sarvāvasāniko lokadhātur vaśī
analyzed: saṃpūjya ekānte nyaṣīdan  atha khalu paścima uttarasyām diśi gaṅgā nadī vālukā upamān lokadhātūn atikramya tebhyaḥ yaḥ sarvāvasānikaḥ lokadhātuḥ vaśī
translated: sat down to one side.

original: bhutā nāma tatraikacchattro nāma tathāgataḥ 'rhan samyaksaṃbuddhas tiṣṭhati dhriyate yāpayati/
analyzed: bhutā nāma tatra ekacchattraḥ nāma tathāgataḥ rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ tiṣṭhati dhriyate yāpayati
translated: Then in the northwest, beyond as many world systems as there are sands in the Ganges River, there is a world system called Vāśibhūta. In that world system there is a tathāgata, an arhat, a perfectly enlightened buddha named Eka-chattra.

original: sa imām eva prajñāpāramitāṃ bodhisattvānāṃ dharmaṃ deśayati/ atha tatra
analyzed: saḥ imām eva prajñāpāramitām bodhisattvānām dharmam deśayati atha tatra
translated: He resides there, enduring, teaching the Dharma. He teaches the bodhisattvas this very perfection of wisdom. Then in that world system

original: lokadhātau ratnottamo nāma bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvas taṃ mahāntam avabhāsaṃ
analyzed: lokadhātau ratnottamaḥ nāma bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ tam mahāntam avabhāsam
translated: there was a bodhisattva mahāsattva named Ratnottama. He saw that great light and heard that great sound.

original: dṛṣṭvā tañ ca mahāntaṃ pṛthivīcālaṃ tañ ca bhagavata āsecanakam ātmabhāvaṃ dṛṣṭvā
analyzed: dṛṣṭvā tam ca mahāntam pṛthivīcālam tam ca bhagavataḥ āsecanakam ātma bhāvam dṛṣṭvā
translated: Seeing that great earthquake and seeing the Blessed One's radiant body,

original: yena bhagavān ratnākaras tathāgato 'rhan samykasaṃbuddhas tenopasaṃkrāmad upasaṃkramya
analyzed: yena bhagavān ratnākaraḥ tathāgataḥ rhan samykasaṃbuddhaḥ tena upasaṃkrāmat upasaṃkramya
translated: he approached the Blessed One, the Tathagata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One Ratnakarashanti. Having approached,

original: tasya bhagavataḥ pādāv abhivandya taṃ tathāgataṃ ratnākaram etad avocat /
analyzed: tasya bhagavataḥ pādau abhivandya tam tathāgatam ratnākaram etat avocat
translated: he bowed his head at the Blessed One's feet and said this to the Tathagata Ratnakarashanti:

original: ko bhagavan hetuḥ kaḥ pratyayo 'sya mahato 'vabhāsasya loke prādurbhāvāya asya ca mahataḥ pṛthivīcālasya asya ca tathāgatasyāsecanakātmabhāvasya
analyzed: kaḥ bhagavan hetuḥ kaḥ pratyayaḥ sya mahataḥ vabhāsasya loke prādurbhāvāya asya ca mahataḥ pṛthivīcālasya asya ca tathāgatasya asecanaka ātma bhāvasya
translated: What, Blessed One, is the cause, what is the reason for the appearance of this great light in the world, for this great earthquake, and for this Tathagata's radiant body?

original: evam ukte ratnākaras tathāgataḥ samantaraśmiṃ bodhisattvam etad avocat/
analyzed: evam ukte ratnākaraḥ tathāgataḥ samantaraśmim bodhisattvam etat avocat
translated: When this was said, the Tathagata Ratnakarashanti said this to the Bodhisattva Samantabhadra:

original: asti kulaputra🔽itaḥ pūrvadakṣiṇasyāṃ diśi gaṅgānadīvālukopamān lokadhātūn atikramya sahā
analyzed: asti kula putra  itas pūrva dakṣiṇasyām diśi gaṅgā nadī vālukā upamān lokadhātūn atikramya sahā
translated: There is, son of noble family,

original: nāma lokadhātuḥ tatra śākyamunir nāma tathāgato 'rhan samyaksambuddhas tiṣṭhati dhriyate yāpayati /
analyzed: nāma lokadhātuḥ tatra śākyamuniḥ nāma tathāgataḥ rhan samyaksambuddhaḥ tiṣṭhati dhriyate yāpayati
translated: east-southeast of here, beyond world systems equal to the sands of the Ganges river, a world system called Saha. There, the Tathagata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One Shakyamuni resides, is steadfast, and lives.

original: sa bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānāṃ prajñāpāramitāṃ samprakāśayati tasyāyām īdṛśo 'nubhāvaḥ/
analyzed: sa bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām prajñāpāramitām samprakāśayati tasyāḥ āyām īdṛśaḥ nubhāvaḥ
translated: That is the power of the one who teaches the perfection of wisdom to the bodhisattva-mahāsattvas.

original: atha khalu samantaraśmir bodhisattvo ratnākaraṃ tathāgatm etad avocat/
analyzed: atha khalu samantaraśmiḥ bodhisattvaḥ ratnākaram tathāgatm etat avocat
translated: Then the bodhisattva Samantaprabhāsa said this to the Tathāgata Ratnākara:

original: gamisyāmy ahaṃ bhagavaṃs tāṃ sahāṃ lokadhātuṃ tañ ca śākyamuniṃ tathāgataṃ darśanāya
analyzed: gamisyāmi aham bhagavan tām sahām lokadhātum tam ca śākyamunim tathāgatam darśanāya
translated: Blessed One, I will go to that Sahā world system to see that Tathāgata Śākyamuni,

original: vandanāya paryupāsanāya tāṃś ca bodhisattvān mahāsattvān bhūyas tvena kumārabhūtān
analyzed: vandanāya paryupāsanāya tān ca bodhisattvān mahāsattvān bhūyas tvena kumāra bhūtān
translated: to pay homage, to serve him, and to see that bodhisattva mahāsattva, who is mostly a prince,

original: dhāraṇīpratilabdhān samādhinirhārakuśalān sarvasamādhivaśipāramitāṃ gatān /
analyzed: dhāraṇī pratilabdhān samādhi nirhāra kuśalān sarva samādhi vaśi pāramitām gatān
translated: who has attained retention, is skilled in the attainment of samādhis, and has gone to the perfection of all samādhis.

original: bhagavān āha gaccha tvaṃ kulaputra yasyedānīṃ kālaṃ manyase/
analyzed: bhagavān āha gaccha tvam kula putra yasya idānīm kālam manyase
translated: The Blessed One said, Go, son of noble family, if you think it is the right time.

original: atha khalu ratnākaras tathāgato nānāratnamayāni suvarṇāvabhāsāni sahasrapatrāṇi padmāni samantaraśmaye bodhisattvāya prādāt/
analyzed: atha khalu ratnākaraḥ tathāgataḥ nānā ratna mayāni suvarṇa avabhāsāni sahasra patrāṇi padmāni samantaraśmaye bodhisattvāya prādāt
translated: Then the Tathāgata Ratnākara gave the bodhisattva Samantaprabhāsa thousands of lotuses made of various jewels, shining with gold.

original: etais tvaṃ kulaputra padmais taṃ śākyamuniṃ tathāgatam abhyavakireḥ/
analyzed: etaiḥ tvam kula putra padmaiḥ tam śākyamunim tathāgatam abhyavakireḥ
translated: Son of noble family, scatter these lotuses over the Tathāgata Śākyamuni.

original: evañ ca vadeḥ ratnākaro bhagavān bhagavantam alpābādhatāṃ paripṛcchaty alpātaṅkatāṃ laghūtthānatāṃ yātrāṃ balaṃ sukhasparśavihāratāṃ paripṛcchati/
analyzed: evam ca vadeḥ ratnākaraḥ bhagavān bhagavantam alpa ābādha tām paripṛcchati alpa ātaṅka tām laghu utthāna tām yātrām balam sukha sparśa vihāra tām paripṛcchati
translated: And say this: 'The Blessed Ratnākara inquires after the Blessed One's health, lightness, strength, and comfort.'

original: imāni ca tena bhagavatā ratnākareṇa tathāgatenārhatā samyaksaṃbuddhena padmāni prahitāni bhagavata iti/
analyzed: imāni ca tena bhagavatā ratnākareṇa tathāgatena arhatā samyaksaṃbuddhena padmāni prahitāni bhagavataḥ iti
translated: And these lotuses have been sent by the Blessed One, the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened Buddha Ratnākara to the Blessed One.'

original: samprajānakārī ca tvaṃ kulaputra buddhakṣetre bhūyāḥ/
analyzed: samprajāna kārī ca tvam kula putra buddhakṣetre bhūyāḥ
translated: And, son of good family, be mindful in the Buddha-field.

original: tat kasya hetor durāsadā hi te bodhisattvā ye tatra sahāyāṃ lokadhātau upapannāḥ/🔽atha khalu samantaraśmir bodhisattvo ratnākarasya tathāgatasya sakāśāt tāni nānāratnamayāni
analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ durāsadāḥ hi te bodhisattvāḥ ye tatra sahāyām lokadhātau upapannāḥ  atha khalu samantaraśmiḥ bodhisattvaḥ ratnākarasya tathāgatasya sakāśāt tāni nānā ratna mayāni
translated: Why is that? Because those bodhisattvas who have been reborn in that Sahā world-system are difficult to approach.🔽Then the bodhisattva Samantaprabhāsa, having taken those lotuses made of various jewels

original: padmāni gṛhītvā suvarṇanirbhāsāniḥsahasrapatrāṇi anekair bodhisattvakoṭiniyutaśatasahasrair
analyzed: padmāni gṛhītvā suvarṇa nirbhāsā niḥsahasra patrāṇi anekaiḥ bodhisattva koṭi niyuta śata sahasraiḥ
translated: from the Tathāgata Ratnākara, golden in color, with a thousand petals, together with many hundreds of thousands of niyutas of koṭis of bodhisattvas,

original: gṛhasthaiḥ pravrajitaiś ca dārakair dārikābhiś ca sārdhaṃ parivṛtaḥ puraskṛtaḥ pūrvasyāṃ
analyzed: gṛhasthaiḥ pravrajitaiḥ ca dārakaiḥ dārikābhiḥ ca sārdham parivṛtaḥ puraskṛtaḥ pūrvasyām
translated: both householders and renunciants, boys and girls, surrounded and escorted, went to the east

original: diśi teṣu gaṅgānadīvālukopameṣu lokadhātuṣu buddhānāṃ bhagavataḥ satkurvan gurūkurvan
analyzed: diśi teṣu gaṅgā nadī vālukā upameṣu lokadhātuṣu buddhānām bhagavataḥ satkurvan gurūkurvan
translated: in the directions, in world systems as numerous as the sands of the Ganges river, honoring the Blessed Buddhas,

original: mānayan pūjayan puṣpadhūpagandhamālyavilepanacūrṇacīvaracchattradhvajapatākāvaijayantībhir
analyzed: mānayan pūjayan puṣpa dhūpa gandha mālya vilepana cūrṇa cīvara chattra dhvaja patākā vaijayantībhiḥ
translated: honoring, venerating, and making offerings with flowers, incense, perfume, garlands, ointments, powders, robes, parasols, banners, flags, and with rows of lamps,

original: yeneyaṃ sahā lokadhātus tena saṃprāptaḥ /
analyzed: yena iyam sahā lokadhātuḥ tena saṃprāptaḥ
translated: he arrived at this Sahā world system.

original: yena ca śākyamunis tathāgatas tenopasaṃkrāntaḥ/
analyzed: yena ca śākyamuniḥ tathāgataḥ tena upasaṃkrāntaḥ
translated: And he approached the Tathāgata Śākyamuni.

original: upasaṃkramya bhagavataḥ pādau śirasābhivandya ekānte 'tiṣṭhat/
analyzed: upasaṃkramya bhagavataḥ pādau śirasā abhivandya ekānte tiṣṭhat
translated: Having approached, he bowed his head at the feet of the Blessed One and stood to one side.

original: ekānte sthitaś ca samantaraśmir bodhisattvo bhagavantaṃ śākyamunim etad avocat/
analyzed: ekānte sthitaḥ ca samantaraśmiḥ bodhisattvaḥ bhagavantam śākyamunim etat avocat
translated: Standing to one side, the bodhisattva Samantrârci said this to the Blessed One, Śākyamuni:

original: ratnākaro bhagavān bhagavantam alpābādhatāṃ paripṛcchaty alpātaṅkatāṃ laghūtthānatāṃ yātrāṃ balaṃ sukhasparśavihāratāṃ ca paripṛcchati/
analyzed: ratnākaraḥ bhagavān bhagavantam alpa ābādha tām paripṛcchati alpa ātaṅka tām laghu utthāna tām yātrām balam sukha sparśa vihāra tām ca paripṛcchati
translated: The Blessed One Ratna-ākara inquires about your few afflictions, your few illnesses, your lightness, your comfort, your energy, and your well-being.

original: imāni ca tena bhagavatā ratnākareṇa tathāgatena nānāratnamayāni suvarṇanirbhāsāni sahasrapatrāṇi padmāni preṣitāni bhagavataḥ/
analyzed: imāni ca tena bhagavatā ratnākareṇa tathāgatena nānā ratna mayāni suvarṇa nirbhāsāni sahasra patrāṇi padmāni preṣitāni bhagavataḥ
translated: And those thousand-petaled lotuses made of various jewels and shining with gold were sent by that Blessed One, the Tathâgata Ratna-ākara, to the Blessed One.

original: atha khalu bhagavān śākyamuniḥ tathāgatas tāni padmāni gṛhītvā yena te paścimottarasyāṃ diśi gaṅgānadīvālukopamā lokadhātavas tena
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavān śākyamuniḥ tathāgataḥ tāni padmāni gṛhītvā yena te paścima uttarasyām diśi gaṅgā nadī vālukā upamāḥ lokadhātavaḥ tena
translated: Then the Blessed One, the Tathagata Shakyamuni, having taken those lotuses, threw them in the direction of those world systems in the northwest, as numerous as the sands of the Ganges river,

original: prākṣipat/ taiś ca padmaiḥ te lokadhātavaḥ sphuṭā abhūvan/
analyzed: prākṣipat taiḥ ca padmaiḥ te lokadhātavaḥ sphuṭāḥ abhūvan
translated: and those lotuses filled those world systems.

original: teṣu ca padmeṣu buddhavigrahāniṣaṇakāḥ teṣu ca buddhakṣetreṣu dharmaṃ deśayanti yad utemām eva prajñāpāramitāpratisaṃyuktāṃ dharmadeśanām/
analyzed: teṣu ca padmeṣu buddha vigrahā niṣaṇakāḥ teṣu ca buddhakṣetreṣu dharmam deśayanti yat uta imām eva prajñāpāramitā pratisaṃyuktām dharma deśanām
translated: And in those lotuses were seated the figures of Buddhas, and in those Buddha-fields they were teaching the Dharma, namely this very teaching of the Dharma connected with the perfection of wisdom.

original: yaiś ca sattvaiḥ sa dharmaḥ śrutas te niyatā abhūvan anuttarāyāṃ samyaksambodhau/
analyzed: yaiḥ ca sattvaiḥ sa dharmaḥ śrutaḥ te niyatāḥ abhūvan anuttarāyām samyaksambodhau
translated: And those beings who heard that Dharma became destined for supreme and perfect awakening.

original: atha khalu te bodhisattvās te ca gṛhasthās te ca pravrajitās te ca dārakās tāś ca
analyzed: atha khalu te bodhisattvāḥ te ca gṛhasthāḥ te ca pravrajitāḥ te ca dārakāḥ tāḥ ca
translated: Then those bodhisattvas, those householders, those renunciants, those boys,

original: dārikās tato ratnāvatyā lokadhātoḥ samantaraśminā bodhisattvena mahāsattvena sārdham
analyzed: dārikāḥ tatas ratnāvatyāḥ lokadhātoḥ samantaraśminā bodhisattvena mahāsattvena sārdham
translated: and those girls, together with the bodhisattva mahasattva Samantabhadra, having come from that Ratnavati world system,

original: āgatāḥ svakasvakaiḥ kuśalamūlair bhagavantaṃ śākyamuniṃ satkṛtya gurūkṛtya sammānya
analyzed: āgatāḥ svaka svakaiḥ kuśala mūlaiḥ bhagavantam śākyamunim satkṛtya gurūkṛtya sammānya
translated: having honored, revered, and worshipped the Blessed One Shakyamuni with their own roots of virtue,

original: saṃpūjyaikānte nyaṣīdan /
analyzed: saṃpūjya ekānte nyaṣīdan
translated: sat down to one side.

original: atha khalv adhastād diśi gaṅgānadīvālukopamān lokadhātūn atikramya tebhyo yaḥ savāvasāniko lokadhātuḥ padmā nāma tatra
analyzed: atha khalu adhastāt diśi gaṅgā nadī vālukā upamān lokadhātūn atikramya tebhyaḥ yaḥ sa vāvasānikaḥ lokadhātuḥ padmā nāma tatra
translated: Then, in the lower direction, beyond worlds as numerous as the sands of the Ganges River, there is a world called Padma,

original: padmaśrīr nāma tathāgataḥ 'rhan samyaksaṃbuddhas tiṣṭhati dhriyate yāpayati/
analyzed: padmaśrīḥ nāma tathāgataḥ rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ tiṣṭhati dhriyate yāpayati
translated: where the Tathagata, Arhat, Samyaksambuddha Padma Shri resides, upholding and enduring.

original: sa imām eva prajñāpāramitāṃ bodhisattvānāṃ dharmaṃ deśayati/🔽atha tatra lokadhātau padmottaro nāma
analyzed: saḥ imām eva prajñāpāramitām bodhisattvānām dharmam deśayati  atha tatra lokadhātau padmottaraḥ nāma
translated: He is teaching the Dharma to the Bodhisattvas through this very perfection of wisdom.🔽Then in that world, there was a Bodhisattva Mahasattva named Padma Uttara,

original: bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvas taṃ mahāntam avabhāsaṃ dṛṣṭvā tañ ca mahāntaṃ pṛthivīcālaṃ
analyzed: bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ tam mahāntam avabhāsam dṛṣṭvā tam ca mahāntam pṛthivīcālam
translated: who, having seen that great light, that great earthquake,

original: tañ ca bhagavata āsecanakam ātmabhāvaṃ dṛṣṭvā yena bhagavān ratnākaras tathāgato
analyzed: tam ca bhagavataḥ āsecanakam ātma bhāvam dṛṣṭvā yena bhagavān ratnākaraḥ tathāgataḥ
translated: and having seen the Blessed One's incomparable body, approached the Blessed Tathagata Arhat Samyaksambuddha Ratnasaṃbhava,

original: 'rhan samykasaṃbuddhas tenopasaṃkrāmad upasaṃkramya tasya bhagavataḥ pādāv abhivandya
analyzed: rhan samykasaṃbuddhaḥ tena upasaṃkrāmat upasaṃkramya tasya bhagavataḥ pādau abhivandya
translated: and having approached, bowed his head to the feet of the Blessed One,

original: taṃ tathāgataṃ ratnākaram etad avocat /
analyzed: tam tathāgatam ratnākaram etat avocat
translated: and said this to the Tathagata Ratnasaṃbhava:

original: ko bhagavan hetuḥ kaḥ pratyayo 'sya mahato 'vabhāsasya loke prādurbhāvāya asya ca mahataḥ pṛthivīcālasya asya ca tathāgatasyāsecanakātmabhāvasya
analyzed: kaḥ bhagavan hetuḥ kaḥ pratyayaḥ sya mahataḥ vabhāsasya loke prādurbhāvāya asya ca mahataḥ pṛthivīcālasya asya ca tathāgatasya asecanaka ātma bhāvasya
translated: What is the cause, Blessed One, what is the condition for the appearance of this great light in the world, for this great earthquake, and for the Tathagata's unblinking gaze?

original: evam ukte ratnākaras tathāgataḥ samantaraśmiṃ bodhisattvam etad avocat/
analyzed: evam ukte ratnākaraḥ tathāgataḥ samantaraśmim bodhisattvam etat avocat
translated: When this was said, the Tathagata Ratnakara said to the Bodhisattva Samantaprabha:

original: asti kulaputra ita upariṣṭād diśi gaṅgānadīvālukopamān lokadhātūn atikramya sahā nāma
analyzed: asti kula putraḥ itas upariṣṭāt diśi gaṅgā nadī vālukā upamān lokadhātūn atikramya sahā nāma
translated: Son of noble family, above here, beyond world systems as numerous as the sands of the Ganges River, there is a world system called Saha.

original: lokadhātuḥ tatra śākyamunir nāma tathāgato 'rhan samyaksambuddhas tiṣṭhati dhriyate yāpayati/
analyzed: lokadhātuḥ tatra śākyamuniḥ nāma tathāgataḥ rhan samyaksambuddhaḥ tiṣṭhati dhriyate yāpayati
translated: There, the Tathagata Shakyamuni, the Arhat, the Fully Enlightened One, abides, sustains, and lives.

original: sa bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānāṃ prajñāpāramitāṃ samprakāśayati tasyāyām īdṛśo 'nubhāvaḥ/
analyzed: sa bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām prajñāpāramitām samprakāśayati tasyāḥ āyām īdṛśaḥ nubhāvaḥ
translated: He is teaching the perfection of wisdom to the Bodhisattva-mahasattvas. That is the kind of power he has.

original: atha khalu samantaraśmir bodhisattvo ratnākaraṃ tathāgatm etad avocat/
analyzed: atha khalu samantaraśmiḥ bodhisattvaḥ ratnākaram tathāgatm etat avocat
translated: Then the Bodhisattva Samantaprabha said to the Tathagata Ratnakara:

original: gamisyāmy ahaṃ bhagavaṃs tāṃ sahāṃ lokadhātuṃ tañ ca śākyamuniṃ tathāgataṃ darśanāya
analyzed: gamisyāmi aham bhagavan tām sahām lokadhātum tam ca śākyamunim tathāgatam darśanāya
translated: Blessed One, I will go to that Saha world system to see that Tathagata Shakyamuni,

original: vandanāya paryupāsanāya tāṃś ca bodhisattvān mahāsattvān bhūyas tvena kumārabhūtān
analyzed: vandanāya paryupāsanāya tān ca bodhisattvān mahāsattvān bhūyas tvena kumāra bhūtān
translated: to pay homage and to serve them, and those bodhisattva mahāsattvas, mostly young men,

original: dhāraṇīpratilabdhān samādhinirhārakuśalān sarvasamādhivaśipāramitāṃ gatān /
analyzed: dhāraṇī pratilabdhān samādhi nirhāra kuśalān sarva samādhi vaśi pāramitām gatān
translated: who have attained retention, are skilled in accomplishing samādhis, and have attained mastery over all samādhis.

original: bhagavān āha gaccha tvaṃ kulaputra yasyedānīṃ kālaṃ manyase/
analyzed: bhagavān āha gaccha tvam kula putra yasya idānīm kālam manyase
translated: The Blessed One said, Go, son of noble family, now is the time for you to do as you think fit.

original: atha khalu ratnākaras tathāgato nānāratnamayāni suvarṇāvabhāsāni sahasrapatrāṇi padmāni samantaraśmaye bodhisattvāya prādāt/
analyzed: atha khalu ratnākaraḥ tathāgataḥ nānā ratna mayāni suvarṇa avabhāsāni sahasra patrāṇi padmāni samantaraśmaye bodhisattvāya prādāt
translated: Then indeed the Tathāgata Ratnākara gave to the bodhisattva Samantrarāja thousands of lotuses made of various jewels, shining with gold,

original: etais tvaṃ kulaputra padmais taṃ śākyamuniṃ tathāgatam abhyavakireḥ/
analyzed: etaiḥ tvam kula putra padmaiḥ tam śākyamunim tathāgatam abhyavakireḥ
translated: and said, With these lotuses, son of noble family, you should strew them over the Tathāgata Śākyamuni,

original: evañ ca vadeḥ ratnākaro bhagavān bhagavantam alpābādhatāṃ paripṛcchaty alpātaṅkatāṃ laghūtthānatāṃ yātrāṃ balaṃ sukhasparśavihāratāṃ paripṛcchati/
analyzed: evam ca vadeḥ ratnākaraḥ bhagavān bhagavantam alpa ābādha tām paripṛcchati alpa ātaṅka tām laghu utthāna tām yātrām balam sukha sparśa vihāra tām paripṛcchati
translated: and say this: 'The Blessed Ratnākara inquires about the Blessed One's lack of illness, lack of affliction, lightness, strength, and comfort.'

original: imāni ca tena bhagavatā ratnākareṇa tathāgatenārhatā samyaksaṃbuddhena padmāni prahitāni bhagavata iti/
analyzed: imāni ca tena bhagavatā ratnākareṇa tathāgatena arhatā samyaksaṃbuddhena padmāni prahitāni bhagavataḥ iti
translated: And these lotuses were sent by the Blessed Tathāgata Ratnākara, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One.

original: samprajānakārī ca tvaṃ kulaputra buddhakṣetre bhūyāḥ/
analyzed: samprajāna kārī ca tvam kula putra buddhakṣetre bhūyāḥ
translated: You should be mindful and attentive in the Buddha-field, noble son.

original: tat kasya hetor durāsadā hi te bodhisattvā ye tatra sahāyāṃ lokadhātau upapannāḥ/🔽atha khalu samantaraśmir bodhisattvo ratnākarasya tathāgatasya sakāśāt tāni nānāratnamayāni
analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ durāsadāḥ hi te bodhisattvāḥ ye tatra sahāyām lokadhātau upapannāḥ  atha khalu samantaraśmiḥ bodhisattvaḥ ratnākarasya tathāgatasya sakāśāt tāni nānā ratna mayāni
translated: Why is that? Those bodhisattvas who have been reborn in the Sahā world-system are difficult to surpass.🔽Then the bodhisattva Samantaprabhāsa, having taken those lotuses made of various jewels

analyzed: padmāni gṛhītvā suvarṇa nirbhāsā niḥsahasra patrāṇi anekaiḥ bodhisattva koṭi niyuta śata sahasraiḥ
translated: from the Tathāgata Ratnākara, golden in color, with a thousand petals, together with many hundreds of thousands of niyutas of koṭīs of bodhisattvas,

original: gṛhasthaiḥ pravrajitaiś ca dārakair dārikābhiś ca sārdhaṃ parivṛtaḥ puraskṛtaḥ pūrvasyāṃ
analyzed: gṛhasthaiḥ pravrajitaiḥ ca dārakaiḥ dārikābhiḥ ca sārdham parivṛtaḥ puraskṛtaḥ pūrvasyām
translated: both householders and renunciants, boys and girls, surrounded and revered, went to the east

original: diśi teṣu gaṅgānadīvālukopameṣu lokadhātuṣu buddhānāṃ bhagavataḥ satkurvan gurūkurvan
analyzed: diśi teṣu gaṅgā nadī vālukā upameṣu lokadhātuṣu buddhānām bhagavataḥ satkurvan gurūkurvan
translated: in those world systems as numerous as the sands of the Ganges River, honoring the Blessed Buddhas, venerating them,

original: mānayan pūjayan puṣpadhūpagandhamālyavilepanacūrṇacīvaracchattradhvajapatākāvaijayantībhir
analyzed: mānayan pūjayan puṣpa dhūpa gandha mālya vilepana cūrṇa cīvara chattra dhvaja patākā vaijayantībhiḥ
translated: worshipping them with flowers, incense, perfumes, garlands, ointments, powders, robes, parasols, flags, and banners,

original: yeneyaṃ sahā lokadhātus tena saṃprāptaḥ /
analyzed: yena iyam sahā lokadhātuḥ tena saṃprāptaḥ
translated: and arrived in this Sahā world system.

original: yena ca śākyamunis tathāgatas tenopasaṃkrāntaḥ/
analyzed: yena ca śākyamuniḥ tathāgataḥ tena upasaṃkrāntaḥ
translated: He approached the Tathāgata Śākyamuni,🔽and having approached, he bowed his head to the feet of the Tathāgata Śākyamuni and addressed him as follows:

original: upasaṃkramya bhagavataḥ pādau śirasābhivandya ekānte 'tiṣṭhat/
analyzed: upasaṃkramya bhagavataḥ pādau śirasā abhivandya ekānte tiṣṭhat
translated: Having approached, he bowed his head at the feet of the Blessed One and stood to one side.

original: ekānte sthitaś ca samantaraśmir bodhisattvo bhagavantaṃ śākyamunim etad avocat/
analyzed: ekānte sthitaḥ ca samantaraśmiḥ bodhisattvaḥ bhagavantam śākyamunim etat avocat
translated: Standing to one side, the bodhisattva Samantrârci said this to the Blessed One, Shakyamuni:

original: ratnākaro bhagavān bhagavantam alpābādhatāṃ paripṛcchaty alpātaṅkatāṃ laghūtthānatāṃ yātrāṃ balaṃ sukhasparśavihāratāṃ ca paripṛcchati/
analyzed: ratnākaraḥ bhagavān bhagavantam alpa ābādha tām paripṛcchati alpa ātaṅka tām laghu utthāna tām yātrām balam sukha sparśa vihāra tām ca paripṛcchati
translated: The Blessed One Ratnakara inquires about the Blessed One's few afflictions, few illnesses, lightness, strength, comfort, and ease.

original: imāni ca tena bhagavatā ratnākareṇa tathāgatena nānāratnamayāni suvarṇanirbhāsāni sahasrapatrāṇi padmāni preṣitāni bhagavataḥ/
analyzed: imāni ca tena bhagavatā ratnākareṇa tathāgatena nānā ratna mayāni suvarṇa nirbhāsāni sahasra patrāṇi padmāni preṣitāni bhagavataḥ
translated: And these lotuses made of various jewels, shining with gold, with a thousand petals, were sent by that Blessed One, the Tathagata Ratnakara, to the Blessed One.

original: atha kahlu bhagavān śākyamuniḥ tathāgatas tāni padmāni gṛhītvā yena te adhas tā
analyzed: atha kahlu bhagavān śākyamuniḥ tathāgataḥ tāni padmāni gṛhītvā yena te adhas tā
translated: Then the Blessed One, the Tathagata Shakyamuni, took those lotuses and threw them in the direction of those world systems below,

original: d diśi gaṅgānadīvālukopamā lokadhātavas tena prākṣipat/
analyzed: diśi gaṅgā nadī vālukā upamāḥ lokadhātavaḥ tena prākṣipat
translated: as many as the sands of the Ganges river, in the southern direction.

original: taiś ca padmaiḥ te lokadhātavaḥ sphuṭā abhūvan/
analyzed: taiḥ ca padmaiḥ te lokadhātavaḥ sphuṭāḥ abhūvan
translated: And those world systems were filled with those lotuses.

original: teṣu ca padmeṣu buddhavigrahāniṣaṇakāḥ teṣu ca buddhakṣetreṣu dharmaṃ deśayanti yad utemām eva prajñāpāramitāpratisaṃyuktāṃ dharmadeśanām/
analyzed: teṣu ca padmeṣu buddha vigrahā niṣaṇakāḥ teṣu ca buddhakṣetreṣu dharmam deśayanti yat uta imām eva prajñāpāramitā pratisaṃyuktām dharma deśanām
translated: And in those lotuses were seated images of Buddhas, and in those Buddha-fields they were teaching the Dharma, namely this very teaching connected with the perfection of wisdom.

original: yaiś ca sattvaiḥ sa dharmaḥ śrutas te niyatā abhūvan anuttarāyāṃ samyaksambodhau/
analyzed: yaiḥ ca sattvaiḥ sa dharmaḥ śrutaḥ te niyatāḥ abhūvan anuttarāyām samyaksambodhau
translated: And those beings who heard that Dharma became destined for full enlightenment.

original: atha khalu te bodhisattvās te ca gṛhasthās te ca pravrajitās te ca dārakās tāś ca🔽dārikās tato ratnāvatyā lokadhātoḥ samantaraśminā bodhisattvena mahāsattvena sārdham
analyzed: atha khalu te bodhisattvāḥ te ca gṛhasthāḥ te ca pravrajitāḥ te ca dārakāḥ tāḥ ca  dārikāḥ tatas ratnāvatyāḥ lokadhātoḥ samantaraśminā bodhisattvena mahāsattvena sārdham
translated: Then those bodhisattvas, those householders, those renunciates, those boys,🔽and those girls, together with the bodhisattva mahāsattva Samantaprabhāsa,

original: āgatāḥ svakasvakaiḥ kuśalamūlair bhagavantaṃ śākyamuniṃ satkṛtya gurūkṛtya sammānya

translated: having come from the world system called Ratnāvatī, having honored, revered, and worshipped the Blessed One Śākyamuni with their own roots of merit,

original: saṃpūjyaikānte nyaṣīdan /
analyzed: saṃpūjya ekānte nyaṣīdan
translated: having praised him with various praises, sat down to one side.

original: atha khalu upariṣṭād diśi gaṅgānadīvālukopamān lokadhātūn atikramya tebhyo yaḥ sarvāvasāniko lokadhātur nandā nāma
analyzed: atha khalu upariṣṭāt diśi gaṅgā nadī vālukā upamān lokadhātūn atikramya tebhyaḥ yaḥ sarvāvasānikaḥ lokadhātuḥ nandā nāma
translated: Then in the upper direction, beyond worlds equal to the sands of the Ganges River, there was a world system called Nanda,

original: tatra nandaśrīr nāma tathāgataḥ 'rhan samyaksaṃbuddhas tiṣṭhati dhriyate yāpayati/
analyzed: tatra nandaśrīḥ nāma tathāgataḥ rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ tiṣṭhati dhriyate yāpayati
translated: and in it there was a thus-gone one, a worthy one, a perfect buddha named Nandaśrī, who was present, remained, and endured.

original: sa imām eva prajñāpāramitāṃ bodhisattvānāṃ dharmaṃ deśayati/🔽atha tatra lokadhātau nanda
analyzed: saḥ imām eva prajñāpāramitām bodhisattvānām dharmam deśayati  atha tatra lokadhātau nanda
translated: He teaches this very perfection of wisdom to the bodhisattvas.🔽Then in that world system, a bodhisattva mahāsattva named Nanda

original: datto nāma bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvas taṃ mahāntam avabhāsaṃ dṛṣṭvā tañ ca
analyzed: dattaḥ nāma bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ tam mahāntam avabhāsam dṛṣṭvā tam ca
translated: Datta, having seen that great light and that

analyzed: mahāntam pṛthivīcālam tam ca bhagavataḥ āsecanakam ātma bhāvam dṛṣṭvā yena bhagavān

original: ratnākaras tathāgato 'rhan samykasaṃbuddhas tenopasaṃkrāmad upasaṃkramya tasya bhagavataḥ
analyzed: ratnākaraḥ tathāgataḥ rhan samykasaṃbuddhaḥ tena upasaṃkrāmat upasaṃkramya tasya bhagavataḥ
translated: Ratnākara, the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One. Having approached, he bowed his head at the feet of the Blessed One

analyzed: pādau abhivandya tam tathāgatam ratnākaram etat avocat

translated: What, Blessed One, is the cause, what is the reason for the appearance of this great light in the world, for this great earthquake, and for this Tathāgata's radiant body?

analyzed: evam ukte ratnākaraḥ tathāgataḥ samantaraśmim bodhisattvam etat avocat
translated: When this was said, the Tathāgata Ratnākara said this to the bodhisattva Samantaprabha:

analyzed: asti kula putraḥ itas dhastāt diśi gaṅgā nadī vālukā upamān lokadhātūn atikramya

Thus,

analyzed: pamaḥ  evam iha śāriputra bodhisattvena mahāsattvena prajñāpāramitāyām sthitvā

translated: Recollection of virtue should be developed.🔽Recollection of generosity should be developed.🔽Recollection of the devas should be developed.🔽Recollection of death should be developed.

original: maraṇasaṃjñā bhāvayitavyā/ sarvaloke🔽anabhiratisaṃjñā bhāvayitavyā/🔽sarvaloke aviśvāsasaṃjñā bhāvayitavyā/
analyzed: maraṇa saṃjñā bhāvayitavyā sarva loke  an abhirati saṃjñā bhāvayitavyā  sarva loke aviśvāsa saṃjñā bhāvayitavyā
translated: Recollection of the body should be developed.🔽Recollection of in-and-out breathing should be developed.🔽Recollection of peace should be developed.

original: parijayasaṃjñā🔽nam bhāvayitavyam/
analyzed: parijaya saṃjñā  nam bhāvayitavyam
translated: Recollection of stilling the mind should be developed.🔽Recollection of what is possible should be developed.

original: saṃvṛtisaṃjñānam bhāvayitavyam/🔽yathārutasaṃjñāna
analyzed: saṃvṛti saṃjñānam bhāvayitavyam  yathāruta saṃjñāna
translated: Recollection of what is impossible should be developed.

original: m bhāvayitavyam/
analyzed: m bhāvayitavyam
translated: Recollection of the elements should be developed.🔽Recollection of the sense-spheres should be developed.🔽Recollection of dependent origination should be developed.🔽Recollection of the six sense bases should be developed.

original: savitarkaḥ savicāraḥ samādhir bhāvayitavyaḥ/ avitarko
analyzed: sa vitarkaḥ sa vicāraḥ samādhiḥ bhāvayitavyaḥ a vitarkaḥ
translated: One should cultivate concentration with initial and sustained thought. One should cultivate concentration without initial thought but with sustained thought.

original: 'vicāramātraḥ samādhir bhāvayitavyaḥ/🔽avitarko 'vicāraḥ samādhir bhāva
analyzed: vicāra mātraḥ samādhiḥ bhāvayitavyaḥ
translated: One should cultivate concentration with applied thought and sustained thought. One should cultivate concentration without applied thought but with sustained thought.🔽One should cultivate concentration without applied thought and without sustained thought.

original: yitavyaḥ/ anājñātam ājñāsyāmīndriyam bhāvayitavyam/🔽ājñendriyam bhāvayi
analyzed: yitavyaḥ an ājñātam ājñāsyāmi indriyam bhāvayitavyam  ājñā indriyam bhāvayi
translated: One should cultivate the faculty of knowing what is not yet known.🔽One should cultivate the faculty of knowing.

original: tavyam/ ājñātāvīndriyam bhāvayitavyam/🔽abhibhvāyatanam bhāvayitavyam/
analyzed: tavyam ājñātāvi indriyam bhāvayitavyam  abhibhvāyatanam bhāvayitavyam
translated: One should cultivate the faculty of having known.🔽One should cultivate the spheres of mastery.

original: kṛtsnāyatanam bhāvayitavyam/
analyzed: kṛtsna āyatanam bhāvayitavyam
translated: One should cultivate the spheres of totality.

original: sarvajñajñānam bhāvayitavyam/🔽śamathavipa
analyzed: sarvajña jñānam bhāvayitavyam  śamatha vipa
translated: One should cultivate omniscient knowledge.

original: śyane bhāvayitavye tisro vidyā bhāvayitavyāḥ/
analyzed: śyane bhāvayitavye tisraḥ vidyāḥ bhāvayitavyāḥ
translated: One should cultivate tranquility and insight. One should cultivate the three knowledges.

original: catasraḥ pratisaṃvido🔽bhāvayitavyāḥ/
analyzed: catasraḥ pratisaṃvidaḥ  bhāvayitavyāḥ
translated: One should cultivate the four analytical knowledges.

original: catvāri caiśāradyāni bhāvayitavyāni/ acyutāḥ
analyzed: catvāri ca aiśāradyāni bhāvayitavyāni acyutāḥ
translated: One should cultivate the four forms of intrepid confidence. One should cultivate the five unhindered [knowledges].

original: pañcābhijñā bhāvayitavyāḥ/
analyzed: pañca abhijñāḥ bhāvayitavyāḥ
translated: One should cultivate the five higher knowledges.

original: ṣaṭ pāramitā bhāvayitavyāḥ/🔽sapta dhanāni
analyzed: ṣaḍ pāramitāḥ bhāvayitavyāḥ  sapta dhanāni
translated: One should cultivate the six perfections.

original: bhāvayitavyāni/
analyzed: bhāvayitavyāni
translated: One should cultivate the seven riches.

original: aṣṭau mahāpuruṣavitarkā bhāvayitavyāḥ/ daśa tathā
analyzed: aṣṭau mahāpuruṣa vitarkāḥ bhāvayitavyāḥ daśa tathā
translated: One should cultivate the eight great thoughts of a superior man. One should cultivate the ten

original: gatabalāni bhāvayitavyāni/
analyzed: gata balāni bhāvayitavyāni
translated: powers of a Tathāgata.

original: aṣṭādaśāveṇikā buddhadharmā bhāvayitavyāḥ/
analyzed: aṣṭādaśa āveṇikāḥ buddha dharmāḥ bhāvayitavyāḥ
translated: One should cultivate the eighteen distinctive qualities of a Buddha.

original: mahāmaitrī bhāvayitavyā/
analyzed: mahā maitrī bhāvayitavyā
translated: One should cultivate great loving-kindness.

original: mahākaruṇā bhāvayitavyā/🔽mahāmuditā bhāvayitavyā/ mahopekṣā
analyzed: mahā karuṇā bhāvayitavyā  mahā muditā bhāvayitavyā mahā upekṣā
translated: One should cultivate great compassion.🔽One should cultivate great sympathetic joy. One should cultivate

original: bhāvayitavyā//
analyzed: bhāvayitavyā
translated: great equanimity.

original: ity adhyāśayasahagato navacandropamaḥ//
analyzed: iti adhyāśaya sahagataḥ nava candra upamaḥ
translated: Thus, [this chapter] is accompanied by superior intention, and is like the new moon.

original: sarvajñatāṃ jñānena darśanena cāvalokyātikramitukāmena bodhisattvena
analyzed: sarvajña tām jñānena darśanena ca avalokya atikramitu kāmena bodhisattvena
translated: By a bodhisattva mahāsattva who wishes to look upon and surpass omniscience with knowledge and vision,

analyzed: mahāsattvena prajñāpāramitā bhāvayitavyā

original: mārgajñatāṃ paripūrayitukāmena

analyzed: sarva ākāra jña tām anuprāptu kāmena sarva sattva citta carita jñāna ākāra tām pari

analyzed: pūrayitu kāmena sarva vāsanā anusandhi kleśān utpāṭayitu kāmena bodhisattvena
translated: by one who wishes to uproot all the afflictions that are latent tendencies and connections, by a bodhisattva

original: mahāsattvena prajñāpāramitāyāṃ yogaḥ karaṇīyaḥ/
analyzed: mahāsattvena prajñāpāramitāyām yogaḥ karaṇīyaḥ
translated: mahāsattva, yoga should be practiced in the perfection of wisdom.

analyzed: evam bodhisattvena mahā

analyzed: sattvena prajñāpāramitāyām śikṣitavyam
translated: mahāsattva, one should train in the perfection of wisdom.

original: bodhisattvanyāmabhavakramitukāmena
analyzed: bodhisattva nyāma bhava kramitu kāmena
translated: By a bodhisattva mahāsattva who wishes to enter the stage of a bodhisattva,

analyzed: śrāvaka pratyekabuddha bhūmim atikramitu kāmena a vinivartanīya bhūmau sthātu kāmena

analyzed: kumāra bhūmim samatikramitu kāmena ṣaḍabhijñāḥ prāptu kāmena sarva sattva citta  carita vispanditāni vijñātu kāmena sarva śrāvaka pratyekabuddhānām jñāna

analyzed: buddhebhyaḥ dānāni dīyamānāni ekena anumodanā sahagatena citta utpādena

analyzed: iti dāna pāramitā sahagataḥ mahā nidhāna upamaḥ

analyzed: citta utpādena abhibhavitu kāmena bodhisattvena mahāsattvena prajñāpāramitāyām śikṣitavyam

original: iti śīlapāramitā
analyzed: iti śīla pāramitā
translated: Thus, the one accompanied by the perfection of morality,

analyzed: sahagataḥ ratna ākara upamaḥ
translated: Accompanied by patience, it is like a mine of jewels.🔽One who wishes to establish those with a hostile mind in patience,

analyzed: vyāpanna cittān kṣāntau pratiṣṭhāpayitu kāmena sarva śrāvaka pratyekabuddhānām

analyzed: kṣāntim ekena anumodanā sahagatena citta utpādena abhibhavitu kāmena bodhisattvena mahāsattvena

translated: should train in the perfection of wisdom.

analyzed: gataḥ mahā arṇava upamaḥ
translated: Thus, accompanied by patience, it is like a great ocean.

analyzed: kuśīdān vīrye pratiṣṭhāpayitu kāmena sarva śrāvaka pratyekabuddhānām vīryam

analyzed: ekena anumodanā sahagatena citta utpādena abhibhavitu kāmena bodhisattvena mahāsattvena

analyzed: prajñāpāramitāyām śikṣitavyam  iti
translated: should train in the perfection of wisdom.

original: vajropamaḥ/
analyzed: vajra upamaḥ
translated: Thus, accompanied by vigor, it is like a vajra.

analyzed: vikṣipta cittān dhyāne pratiṣṭhāpayitu kāmena sarva śrāvaka pratyekabuddhānām

original: dhyānam ekenānumodanāsahagatena cittotpādenābhibhavitukāmena bodhisattvena mahāsattvena
analyzed: dhyānam ekena anumodanā sahagatena citta utpādena abhibhavitu kāmena bodhisattvena mahāsattvena
translated: with a single thought accompanied by rejoicing, a bodhisattva mahāsattva

original: prajñāpāramitāyāṃ śikṣitavyam //
analyzed: prajñāpāramitāyām śikṣitavyam
translated: should train in the perfection of wisdom.

analyzed: iti dhyāna pāramitā
translated: Thus, the perfection of meditation is

original: sahagataḥ parvatopamaḥ/
analyzed: sahagataḥ parvata upamaḥ
translated: The one associated with patience is like a mountain.

original: duṣprajñān sattvān prajñāyāṃ pratiṣṭhāpayitukāmena sarvaśrāvakapratyekabuddhānām
analyzed: duṣprajñān sattvān prajñāyām pratiṣṭhāpayitu kāmena sarva śrāvaka pratyekabuddhānām
translated: One who wishes to establish beings with little wisdom in wisdom,

analyzed: prajñām ekena anumodanā sahagatena citta utpādena abhibhavitu kāmena bodhisattvena mahāsattvena

original: prajñāpāramitāyāṃ śikṣitavyam //
analyzed: prajñāpāramitāyām śikṣitavyam
translated: that bodhisattva mahāsattva should train in the perfection of wisdom.

original: iti prajñāsahagato
analyzed: iti
translated: Thus, the one associated with wisdom

analyzed: mahā bhaiṣajya upamaḥ  ekam api kuśala citta utpādam sarva ākārajña tāyām upādāya kauśalyena
translated: is like a great medicine.

analyzed: alpam api dānam dadatā alpam api śīlam
translated: even one protecting a little morality,

translated: even one cultivating a little patience, even one undertaking a little effort,

analyzed: alpam api dhyānam samāpadyamānena alpām api prajñām bhāvayatā sarva sattvebhyaḥ
translated: even one entering a little concentration, even one cultivating a little wisdom, for all beings

analyzed: sarva ākāra jña tāyām upādāya kauśalyena pariṇāmanayā aprameyam asaṃkhyeyam kartu
translated: taking it up in all aspects for the knowledge of all aspects, through skillful dedication, to make it immeasurable and incalculable,

analyzed: kāmena bodhisattvena mahāsattvena prajñāpāramitāyām śikṣitavyam
translated: The bodhisattva mahāsattva Kāma should train in the perfection of wisdom.

original: punar aparaṃ śāriputra bodhisattvena mahāsattvena
analyzed: punar aparam śāriputra bodhisattvena mahāsattvena
translated: Furthermore, Śāriputra, the bodhisattva mahāsattva

translated: should train in the perfection of wisdom while practicing the perfection of giving, and similarly while practicing the perfection of morality,

original: pāramitāyāñ caratā kṣāntipāramitāyāñ caratā vīryapāramitāyāñ caratā
analyzed: pāramitāyām caratā kṣānti pāramitāyām caratā vīrya pāramitāyām caratā
translated: the perfection of patience, the perfection of perseverance,

translated: and the perfection of concentration. The bodhisattva mahāsattva should train in the perfection of wisdom while practicing the perfection of wisdom.

analyzed: sattvānām arthāya naraka tiryagyoni yama loka duḥkhāni utsoḍhu kāmena kalpa

original: kāmena aśītyanuvyañjanāni dvātriṃśatmahāpuruṣalakṣaṇāni ca niṣpādayitu
analyzed: kāmena aśīti anuvyañjanāni dvātriṃśat mahāpuruṣa lakṣaṇāni ca niṣpādayitu
translated: desiring to accomplish the eighty minor marks and the thirty-two major marks of a great man,

original: kāmena bodhisattvena mahāsattvena prajñāpāramitāyāṃ śikṣitavyam//
analyzed: kāmena bodhisattvena mahāsattvena prajñāpāramitāyām śikṣitavyam
translated: the bodhisattva mahāsattva should train in the perfection of wisdom.

original: ity upāyasahagato mitropamaḥ//
analyzed: iti upāya sahagataḥ mitra upamaḥ
translated: Thus, accompanied by means, it is like a friend.

original: punar aparaṃ śāriputra buddhakāyaṃ niṣpādayitukāmena bodhisattvena mahāsattvena prajñāpāramitāyāṃ śikṣitavyam/
analyzed: punar aparam śāriputra buddha kāyam niṣpādayitu kāmena bodhisattvena mahāsattvena prajñāpāramitāyām śikṣitavyam
translated: Furthermore, Śāriputra, a bodhisattva mahāsattva who wishes to accomplish the Buddha's body should train in the perfection of wisdom.

original: kumārabhūmim ākramitukāmena bodhisattvena mahāsattvena prajñāpāramitāyāṃ śikṣitavyam/🔽buddhabodhisattvair avirahitena
analyzed: kumāra bhūmim ākramitu kāmena bodhisattvena mahāsattvena prajñāpāramitāyām śikṣitavyam  buddha bodhisattvaiḥ avirahitena
translated: A bodhisattva mahāsattva who wishes to enter the stage of a youth should train in the perfection of wisdom.

analyzed: bhavitu kāmena bodhisattvena mahāsattvena prajñāpāramitāyām śikṣitavyam
translated: A bodhisattva mahāsattva who wishes to be inseparable from the Buddhas and bodhisattvas should train in the perfection of wisdom.

analyzed: punar aparam śāriputra bodhisattvena mahāsattvena ekena svarena pūrvasyām diśi
translated: Furthermore, Śāriputra, a bodhisattva mahāsattva who wishes to make known with a single voice the worlds in the eastern direction,

original: gaṅgānadīvālukopamān lokadhātūn vijñāpayitukāmena prajñāpāramitāyāṃ🔽śikṣitavyam/

original: kartukāmena gurūkartukāmena mānayitukāmena pūjayitukāmena prajñāpāramitāyāṃ śikṣitavyaṃ

analyzed: punar aparam śāriputra bodhisattvena mahāsattvena sarva sattvān dāna maya
translated: Furthermore, Śāriputra, a bodhisattva mahāsattva who wishes to establish all beings in the basis of meritorious action consisting of giving,

analyzed: puṇya kriyā vastuni pratiṣṭhāpayitu kāmena śīla maya puṇya kriyā vastuni
translated: in the basis of meritorious action consisting of morality,

original: pratiṣṭhāpayitukāmena bhāvanāmayapuṇyakriyāvastuni pratiṣṭhāpayitukāmena vaiyāvṛtyasahagate caupadhike

analyzed: puṇya kriyā vastuni pratiṣṭhāpayitu kāmena prajñāpāramitāyām śikṣitavyam
translated: One who wishes to establish in the merit-making activity that arises from meditation, and in the merit-making activity that is associated with service and is based on gifts, should train in the perfection of wisdom.

original: punar aparaṃ śāriputra bodhisattvena mahāsattvena pañca cakṣūṃṣy utpādayitukāmena prajñāpāramitāyāṃ śikṣitavyam/
analyzed: punar aparam śāriputra bodhisattvena mahāsattvena pañca cakṣūṃṣi utpādayitu kāmena prajñāpāramitāyām śikṣitavyam
translated: Again, Śāriputra, a bodhisattva mahāsattva who wishes to produce the five eyes should train in the perfection of wisdom.

original: katamāni pañca
analyzed: katamāni pañca
translated: What are the five?

original: yad uta māṃsacakṣur divyacakṣuḥ prajñācakṣur dharmacakṣur buddhacakṣur utpādayitukāmena
analyzed: yat uta māṃsa cakṣuḥ divya cakṣuḥ prajñā cakṣuḥ dharma cakṣuḥ buddha cakṣuḥ utpādayitu kāmena
translated: Namely, the flesh eye, the divine eye, the wisdom eye, the Dharma eye, and the Buddha eye.

original: prajñāpāramitāyāṃ śikṣitavyam/🔽punar aparaṃ śāriputra bodhisattvena mahāsattvena pūrvasyāṃ diśi divyena cakṣuṣā gaṅgānadīvālukopamān
analyzed: prajñāpāramitāyām śikṣitavyam  punar aparam śāriputra bodhisattvena mahāsattvena pūrvasyām diśi divyena cakṣuṣā gaṅgā nadī vālukā upamān
translated: One who wishes to produce them should train in the perfection of wisdom.

original: bhagavato draṣṭukāmena prajñāpāramitāyāṃ śikṣitavyam/

translated: Again, Śāriputra, a bodhisattva mahāsattva who wishes to see with the divine eye in the eastern direction buddhas, bhagavats, as numerous as the sands of the Ganges river, should train in the perfection of wisdom.

original: evaṃ dakṣīṇasyāṃ diśi divyena cakṣuṣā
analyzed: evam dakṣīṇasyām diśi divyena cakṣuṣā
translated: In the same way, one who wishes to see with the divine eye in the southern direction

original: gaṅgānadīvālukopamān buddhān bhagavato draṣṭukāmena prajñāpāramitāyāṃ śikṣitavyaṃ
analyzed: gaṅgā nadī vālukā upamān buddhān bhagavataḥ draṣṭu kāmena prajñāpāramitāyām śikṣitavyam
translated: buddhas, bhagavats, as numerous as the sands of the Ganges river, should train in the perfection of wisdom.

original: evaṃ paścimāyām diśi divyena cakṣuṣā gaṅgānadīvālukopamān buddhān bhagavato draṣṭukāmena prajñāpāramitāyāṃ śikṣitavyaṃ/

translated: In the same way, one who wishes to see with the divine eye Buddhas, Blessed Ones, as numerous as the sands of the Ganges River in the western direction, should train in the perfection of wisdom.
